context: These results demonstrated that the OWG sensor was fully reversible and reproducible for chlorobenzene gas sensing. The OWG sensor discussed above was used to identify several VOC gases such as benzene, toluene, chlorobenzene, xylene, ethanol, acetone, methanol, diethyl ether as well as formaldehyde. Fig. 6 shows the response of the OWG sensor to 1000ppm of various gases. Experimental result shows that PTA film/K+-exchanged glass OWG sensor has strong responses to aromatic hydrocarbon gases such as benzene, toluene, chlorobenzene, and xylene. But the responses to other VOCs are weaker. Among chlorobenzene, benzene, toluene, and xylene of the same concentration, the sensor has a higher response to chlorobenzene. Therefore, the typical response to the chlorobenzene gas of PTA film/K+-exchanged glass OWG sensor was mainly studied as discussed above.
